programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

Chris sets off on his scheduled two-day trip from the station at the port of Pointe-Noire, ending his journey six days - and a whole series of setbacks - later.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet

programme.desc: A plot to kill the fuhrer that remained secret until the late 1990s. Operation Foxley planned to murder Hitler during his daily morning walk at the Berghof, his Bavarian residence. Two soldiers parachuted into the area were supposed to find a perfect location to shoot Hitler and stop the devastating war. Based on the British Secret Services' declassified documents, using archives and fictionalised reconstitutions, this film recounts the full story and the detailed plan that should have led to the murder of Adolf Hitler, and explains why it failed..

programme.desc: The veteran naturalist investigates two shells that have proved to be winners in evolution - the bird's egg shell and the hard shell of the tortoise. The ostrich egg is so strong it is possible for it to take a person's weight without breaking - so how does a chick manage break out of such a fortress? The evolution of the tortoise shell was for a long time a mystery, and this bony box offers a lot more than just protection.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities

programme.title: Planet Earth II

programme.title: Galapagos

programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned prison beneath the water, a tunnel in the heart of a mountain, concrete towers hidden in the woods and a rusting coastal relic.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second visit to Trentham Gardens near Stoke-on-Trent, where items featured include an early camera which had previously been used for natural history photography, a dagger with a gruesome history, a shawl that once belonged to a movie star, and a small 18th-century figurine.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned prison beneath the water, a tunnel in the heart of a mountain, concrete towers hidden in the woods and a rusting coastal relic.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Some of the most shocking cases connected with the regime's bloody reign, beginning with the case of Hitler's niece Geli Raubal, who was found dead in his apartment in 1931.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a railway journey through the Republic of Ireland from Co Kerry to the city of Galway. On the first leg, he travels from Killarney to Cobh, sampling 19th-century delicacies and exploring a stunning landscape that achieved fame due to rails and royals.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Charleville, Co Cork, to the city of Waterford, along the way finding out about the ancient art of making butter, attempting to learn the basics of Ireland's oldest game, and riding on the Duke of Devonshire's Victorian railway.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris crosses Australia from south to north following the original ill-fated route of the 2,000 mile-long Adelaide to Darwin railway. After beginning his journey on a luxury modern train, he transfers to one of the line's surviving steam locomotives before hitting the Outback, where he quickly concludes that a 4x4 is a more practical means of travelling. He passes through ghost towns and explores abandoned railway relics before uncovering why most of the southern section of the line eventually had to be abandoned. At Alice Springs he hitches a ride on a freight train headed for Darwin and reaches his final destination after nearly 24 hours in the cramped cab.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Dennis does his bit to cement Anglo-German relations by taking Dagmar for a quiet weekend away. Unfortunately for him, Wayne and Barry blunder in at the crucial moment and reduce his planned seduction to a building-site get-together.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads encounter a fellow Brit while spending a relaxing weekend in the country - but his hunger, exhaustion and evasive behaviour arouse their suspicions. Ray Winstone guests alongside regulars Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright loses his trousers on the way to the wedding of Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's niece, and ends up having to borrow a pair of her trousers to wear at the event.

programme.title: Open All Hours

While trying to work one another out, the team treads carefully in the case of a murdered vicar who received racist hate mail in the lead up to his death. With emotions running high, it's up to Ted to pull together his new unit and keep the peace in one of UCOS's most sensitive cases. Starring Larry Lamb, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

Guest starring Craig Kelly and Freema Agyeman.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.desc: A middle-class couple's adopted child is kidnapped, a case that takes Gently and Bacchus to a home where unmarried mothers are forced to give up their babies. Suspicion initially falls upon the natural mother, who is thought to have 'stolen' her baby back. But further investigations reveal a much darker side to the adoption home itself and raise questions as to how far this seemingly perfect couple were prepared to go to become parents. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Mark Gatiss, Helen Baxendale and Alison Steadman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Ted leads an investigation into the apparent suicide of a city trader who was embroiled in the cut-throat world of London's financial district in the 1980s. As the team delve deeper into the macho fraternity of 'The Wolfpack', they find a darker side to the debauchery, secret hand signals and all-nighters that bonded the traders together - including a strict hierarchy that might be worth killing for. Meanwhile, Steve tries to learn some tricks of the trade, amid his own financial crisis. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detectives are called out to a robbery where a security guard is found dead. As they try to determine whether his demise was an accident or murder, they expose a complex web of deception among his friends - or enemies. Meanwhile, Lateef uncovers evidence of an international exchange racket. Art Malik guest stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team takes on three cases at once in-between major murder investigations. Harry deals with a hit-and-run on a council estate, Leo investigates the cause of a fire that left a woman dead, and Nikki is called out when a bride-to-be collapses and dies on her hen night. Starring Tom Ward, William Gaminara and Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII sets out to establish himself as the new sovereign, but finds a dangerous, deeply divided kingdom. Lizzie's loyalties are further complicated by the child she is expecting. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Fern Britton presents the kitchen challenge, which sees her husband - This Morning chef Phil Vickery - taking another nine amateurs through three tests of their culinary skills. They begin by finely slicing fennel bulbs, before filleting and skinning cod, with only the best three going forward to the final challenge, which sees them cooking the fish with whatever ingredients they choose from the larder.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV Live: Royal Ascot
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present behind-closed-doors coverage of the opening day of the festival, featuring the 1.50 Queen Anne Stakes and supporting races including the 2.25 Ribblesdale Stakes and 3.35 King's Stand Stakes. With analysis from Jason Weaver, Kevin Blake and Johnny Murtagh, reports by Luke Harvey, Mick Fitzgerald and Matt Chapman, commentary by Richard Hoiles and social stable interaction from Oli Bell.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Ollie, Suzanne, Rachel and Nick pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa and Martin search for a nursery now that Janice has left, and Mrs Tishell is shocked to find out that Al has very high blood pressure. Louisa also helps with the diagnosis of a pupil, which spurs her on to explore the possibilities of a change of career. This is not welcome news for Martin, who dislikes any kind of change, even if it could be for the better. Elsewhere, Ruth is approached about selling her farm. Starring Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz, Selina Cadell and Ian McNeice.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts six more contestants through their paces to see who will have the opportunity to answer 15 questions to win the prize of £1,000,000. Each player has four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal.

programme.title: Alexander Armstrong's Land of the Midnight Sun
programme.desc: The presenter continues his epic 8,000-mile journey halfway around the Arctic Circle deep in mid-winter. He embarks on the second leg of his odyssey, beginning in Iceland before travelling to the icy wilderness of Greenland. Along the way, Alexander snorkels over a vast underwater crevasse separating two continental landmasses and wrestles with a female Viking. He also joins two Danish Special Forces soldiers and their huskies, who have the loneliest job on the planet, and witnesses an array of natural wonders.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Unbelievable Moments Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents a selection of extraordinary eyewitness footage filmed by members of the public, including the dramatic story of an amateur pilot who built his own plane, but then lost his propeller mid-flight and had to try to land it without any power. A local resident in northern California tries to flee what goes down in history as the state's deadliest wildfire, and a cliff collapse at a popular tourist spot in Greece causes chaos.

programme.title: Ross Kemp Living With
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part special to begin the second series, the actor and film-maker examines the real-life impact of dementia. He meets Scott Mitchell, the husband of his former on-screen mum Barbara Windsor, who was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2014. Ross also travels to Leatherhead, Surrey, where he stays with Jerry Beckman, an actor, magician and keen sportsman who has early-onset dementia and Parkinson's disease.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Phil Vickery, husband of host Fern Britton, acts as judge as nine home cooks are whittled down in three intense culinary battles. Phil starts by demonstrating how to finely puree garlic before contestants must attempt their own in just five minutes. Then six players are tasked to prepare a loin of venison from a rack, before the last three are given just two minutes to select from the larder containing an array of fresh fruit and vegetables, pulses and grains, condiments and sauce ingredients to pare with their prepared venison. A prize of £1,000 awaits the successful candidate.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.
